\u2013 Battle of Al Kasr al Kebir \u2013 the Moroccans defeat the Portuguese. This initiates a succession crisis in Portugal.", "1693 \u2013 Date traditionally ascribed to Dom Perignon's invention of Champagne, although he actually did not have anything to do with sparkling wine.", "1704 \u2013 War of the Spanish Succession: Gibraltar is captured by an English and Dutch fleet, commanded by Admiral Sir George Rooke and allied with Archduke Charles.", "1789 \u2013 In France members of the National Constituent Assembly take an oath to end feudalism and abandon their privileges.", "1790 \u2013 A newly passed tariff act creates the Revenue Cutter Service (the forerunner of the United States Coast Guard).", "1791 \u2013 The Treaty of Sistova is signed, ending the Ottoman-Habsburg wars.", "1796 \u2013 French Revolutionary Wars: Napoleon leads the French Army of Italy to victory in the Battle of Lonato.", "1821 \u2013 Atkinson & Alexander publish the Saturday Evening Post for the first time as a weekly newspaper.", "1824 \u2013 The Battle of Kos is fought between Turk and Greek forces.", "1854 \u2013 The Hinomaru is established as the official flag to be flown from Japanese ships.", "1863 \u2013 Matica slovensk\u00e1, Slovakia's public-law cultural and scientific institution focusing on topics around the Slovak nation, is established in Martin.", "1873 \u2013 Indian Wars: whilst protecting a railroad survey party in Montana, the United States 7th Cavalry, under Lieutenant Colonel George Armstrong Custer clashes for the first time with the Sioux near the Tongue River; only one man on each side is killed.", "1892 \u2013 The father and stepmother of Lizzie Borden are found murdered in their Fall River, Massachusetts home.", "1902 \u2013 The Greenwich foot tunnel under the River Thames opens.", "1906 \u2013 Central Railway Station, Sydney opens.", "1914 \u2013 World War I: Germany invades Belgium.
